user-story.i-want: granular control over who can see my information and how my data is used
user-story.so-that: I can manage compliance preferences and protect my personal data.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Privacy settings page surfaces profile visibility, data sharing, tagging, search-by-phone, and marketing consent toggles with descriptive helper text. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#implementation-guide]

Saving privacy settings instantly updates server values and returns the effective configuration; UI confirms success and rolls back on failure. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#profile-management-flow]
`PrivacyManager` enforces visibility rules for public, friends-only, and private queries including blocked user lists. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#privacy-settings-entity]
**COMPLIANCE CRITICAL**: Consent changes generate audit log entries and emit analytics event `privacy_settings_changed`. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#analytics-events]
DSAR export/delete actions reference latest privacy settings and require explicit confirmation modal before proceeding. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#implementation-guide]

task.description: Create `privacy_settings_page.dart` with grouped toggles, inline learn-more links, and WCAG-compliant contrast.

Implement `privacy_manager.dart` applying business rules for visibility, blocked users, and consent toggles.
Update `profile_endpoint.dart` to persist privacy settings and emit audit log + segment event.
Add integration test `privacy_visiblity_enforcement_test.dart` ensuring correct data filtering.
Record audit entries in `privacy_audit_log` table (migration add) with actor, change summary, timestamp.
